message.content:
We first extract the necessary end‐of‐period figures from the balance sheet and income statement (all “End_amount” values dated 2024‑01‑28):

• Current Assets (ended): 
 – Cash on Hand = 3,730,866.78  
 – Bank Deposits = 3,938,781.80  
 – Interest Receivable = 10,811.11  
 – Accounts Receivable = 1,562,598.26  
 – Inventory = 720,000.00  
 Total Current Assets is given as 9,963,057.95  

• Total Current Liabilities = Accounts Payable + Taxes Payable = 545,000.00 + 284,755.77 = 829,755.77  

• Total Assets = 15,023,526.85  

• Owner’s Equity (End) = 14,193,771.08  
 Initial Owner’s Equity (from balance sheet initial) = Paid-in Capital + (initial Retained Earnings) = 13,000,000.00 + 0 = 13,000,000.00  
 ⇒ Average Owner’s Equity = (13,000,000.00 + 14,193,771.08) / 2 ≈ 13,596,885.54  

• Operating cash flow (from Cash Flow Statement) = –224,133.22  

• Income Statement figures:  
 – Main Business Revenue = 5,695,115.02  
 – Net Profit = 1,193,771.08  

• Accounts Receivable:  
 Initial = 0.00, End = 1,562,598.26  
 ⇒ Average Accounts Receivable = (0 + 1,562,598.26) / 2 = 781,299.13

Now we calculate each ratio:

1. Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio  
 = (Operating Cash Flow) / (Current Liabilities)  
 = (–224,133.22) / (829,755.77)  
 ≈ –0.27

2. Debt to Equity Ratio  
 Here, “Debt” is taken as the total current liabilities (since there are no non‐current liabilities given).  
 = (Current Liabilities) / (Owner’s Equity at End)  
 = 829,755.77 / 14,193,771.08  
 ≈ 0.06

3. Total Asset Turnover Ratio  
 = (Revenue) / (Total Assets)  
 = 5,695,115.02 / 15,023,526.85  
 ≈ 0.38

4. Quick Ratio  
 Quick Assets = Current Assets – Inventory  
  = 9,963,057.95 – 720,000.00  
  = 9,243,057.95  
 Then,  
 Quick Ratio = Quick Assets / Current Liabilities  
 ≈ 9,243,057.95 / 829,755.77  
 ≈ 11.14

5. Operating Cash Flow Ratio  
 (This is the same as the Operating Cash Flow to Current Liabilities Ratio here.)  
 ≈ –0.27

6. Return on Equity (ROE)  
 Using the net profit over average owner’s equity:  
 = (Net Profit) / (Average Owner’s Equity)  
 = 1,193,771.08 / 13,596,885.54  
 ≈ 0.0878 or 8.78%

7. Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio  
 = (Revenue) / (Average Accounts Receivable)  
 = 5,695,115.02 / 781,299.13  
 ≈ 7.29

Thus, the solution in the required JSON format is:

{
  "solution": {
    "operating cash flow to current liabilities ratio": "-0.27",
    "Debt to Equity Ratio": "0.06",
    "Total Asset Turnover Ratio": "0.38",
    "Quick Ratio": "11.14",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-0.27",
    "Return on Equity (ROE)": "8.78%",
    "Accounts Receivable Turnover Ratio": "7.29"
  }
}
